name: stripe
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Stripe resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`stripe` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/lukasaron/terraform-provider-stripe).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Stripe resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/lukasaron/terraform-provider-stripe)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-stripe` repo](https://github.com/georgegebbett/pulumi-stripe/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-stripe` repo](https://github.com/lukasaron/terraform-provider-stripe/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/lukasaron/terraform-provider-stripe)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-stripe` repo](https://github.com/georgegebbett/pulumi-stripe/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-stripe` repo](https://github.com/lukasaron/terraform-provider-stripe/issues).

created.description: String. Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

expired.description: Bool. Returns if the link is already expired.

expiresAt.description: Int. The link isn’t available after this future timestamp.

id.description: String. Unique identifier for the object.

livemode.description:
Bool. Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` 
if the object exists in test mode.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. 
This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: String. String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

url.description: String. The publicly accessible URL to download the file.

create.description:
Bool. Set this to `true` to create a file link for the newly created file. 
Creating a link is only possible when the file’s purpose is one of the following: `business_icon`, `business_logo`,
`customer_signature`, `dispute_evidence`, `pci_document`, `tax_document_user_upload`, or `terminal_reader_splashscreen`.

expiresAt.description: Int. The link isn’t available after this future timestamp.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. 
This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

headline.description: String. The messaging shown to customers in the portal.

privacyPolicyUrl.description: String. A link to the business's publicly available privacy policy.

termsOfServiceUrl.description: String. A link to the business's publicly available terms of service.

customerUpdate.description: List(Resource). Information about updating the customer details in the portal. See Customer Update.

invoiceHistory.description: List(Resource). Information about showing the billing history in the portal. See Invoice History.

paymentMethodUpdate.description: List(Resource). Information about updating payment methods in the portal. See Payment Method Update.

subscriptionCancel.description: List(Resource). Information about canceling subscriptions in the portal. See Subscription Cancel.

subscriptionPauses.description: List(Resource). Information about pausing subscriptions in the portal. See Subscription Pause.

subscriptionUpdates.description: List(Resource). Information about updating subscriptions in the portal. See Subscription Update.

allowedUpdates.description: List(String). The types of customer updates that are supported [`name`, `email`, `address`, `shipping`, `phone`, `tax_id`]. When empty, customers are not updatable.

enabled.description: Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.
Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.
Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.

cancellationReason.description: List(Resource). Whether the cancellation reasons will be collected in the portal and which options are exposed to the customer. Details of this field is in Cancellation Reason.

enabled.description: Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.

mode.description: String. Whether to cancel subscriptions immediately or at the end of the billing period. Valid value is either `immediately` or `at_period_end`

prorationBehavior.description: String. Whether to create prorations when canceling subscriptions. Possible values are `none` and `create_prorations`, which is only compatible with `mode=immediately`. No prorations are generated when canceling a subscription at the end of its natural billing period.

enabled.description: Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.

options.description: List(String). Which cancellation reasons will be given as options to the customer. Supported values are `too_expensive`, `missing_features`, `switched_service`, `unused`, `customer_service`, `too_complex`, `low_quality`, and `other`.

enabled.description: Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.

defaultAllowedUpdates.description: List(String). The types of subscription updates that are supported. When empty, subscriptions are not updatable. Supported values are `price`, `quantity`, and `promotion_code`.

enabled.description: Bool. Whether the feature is enabled.

products.description: List(Resource). The list of products that support subscription updates. See details Products.

prorationBehavior.description: String. Whether to create prorations when canceling subscriptions. Possible values are `none` and `create_prorations`, which is only compatible with `mode=immediately`. No prorations are generated when canceling a subscription at the end of its natural billing period.

prices.description: List(String). The list of price IDs for the product that a subscription can be updated to.

enabled.description: Bool. Set to true to generate a shareable URL login_page.url that will take your customers to a hosted login page for the customer portal.

url.description: A shareable URL to the hosted portal login page. Your customers will be able to log in with their email and receive a link to their customer portal.

currency.description: String. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase - [supported currencies](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

customUnitAmount.description:
List(Resource). When set, 
provides configuration for the amount to be adjusted by the customer during Checkout Sessions and Payment Links.
See details in custom unit amount.

taxBehavior.description:
String. Only required if a default tax behavior was not provided in the Stripe Tax settings. 
Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes.
One of `inclusive`, `exclusive`, or `unspecified`.
Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed.

tiers.description:
List(Resource). Each element represents a pricing tier. 
This parameter requires `billing_scheme` to be set to `tiered`. This resource can be used more than once and follows
the same fields as the root tiers block

unitAmount.description: Int. A positive integer in cents (or -1 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

unitAmountDecimal.description:
Float. Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents with at most 12
decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

enabled.description: Bool. Pass in `true` to enable `custom_unit_amount`, otherwise omit `custom_unit_amount`.

maximum.description: Int. The maximum unit amount the customer can specify for this item.

minimum.description:
Int. The minimum unit amount the customer can specify for this item. 
Must be at least the minimum charge amount.

preset.description: Int. The starting unit amount which can be updated by the customer.

flatAmount.description:
Int. The flat billing amount for an entire tier, regardless of the number of units in the
tier.

flatAmountDecimal.description:
Float. Same as `flat_amount`, but accepts a decimal value representing an integer
in the minor units of the currency. Only one of `flat_amount` and `flat_amount_decimal` can be set.

unitAmount.description: Int. The per-unit billing amount for each individual unit for which this tier applies.

unitAmountDecimal.description:
Float. Same as `unit_amount`, but accepts a decimal value in cents with at most 12
decimal places. Only one of `unit_amount` and `unit_amount_decimal` can be set.

upTo.description:
Int. Specifies the upper bound of this tier. The lower bound of a tier is the upper bound of the
previous tier adding one. Use `-1` to define a fallback tier.

aggregateUsage.description:
String. Specifies a usage of aggregation strategy for prices of `usage_type=metered`.
Allowed values are `sum` for summing up all usage during a period, `last_during_period` for using the last usage
record reported within a period, `last_ever` for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or `max`
which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period.

interval.description: String. Specifies billing frequency. Either `day`, `week`, `month` or `year`.

intervalCount.description:
Int. This parameter is (Required) when interval value is set. The number of intervals between subscription billings. For
example, `interval=month` and `interval_count=3` bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year,
12 months, or 52 weeks).

usageType.description:
String. Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either `metered`
or `licensed`. `licensed` automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. `metered` aggregates
the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to `licensed`.

flatAmount.description:
Int. The flat billing amount for an entire tier, regardless of the number of units in the
tier.

flatAmountDecimal.description:
Float. Same as `flat_amount`, but accepts a decimal value representing an integer
in the minor units of the currency. Only one of `flat_amount` and `flat_amount_decimal` can be set.

unitAmount.description: Int. The per-unit billing amount for each individual unit for which this tier applies.

unitAmountDecimal.description:
Float. Same as `unit_amount`, but accepts a decimal value in cents with at most 12
decimal places. Only one of `unit_amount` and `unit_amount_decimal` can be set.

upTo.description:
Int. Specifies the upper bound of this tier. The lower bound of a tier is the upper bound of the
previous tier adding one. Use `-1` to define a fallback tier.

divideBy.description: Int. Divide usage by this number.

round.description: String. After division, either round the result `up` or `down`.

firstTimeTransaction.description: Bool. A Boolean indicating if the Promotion Code should only be redeemed for Customers without any successful payments or invoices.

minimumAmount.description: Int. Minimum amount required to redeem this Promotion Code into a Coupon (e.g., a purchase must be $100 or more to work).

maximum.description:
List(Resource. The upper bound of the estimated range.
Please see Delivery Estimate Definition.

minimum.description:
List(Resource). The lower bound of the estimated range. 
Please see Delivery Estimate Definition.

unit.description: String. A unit of time. Possible values `hour`, `day`, `business_day`, `week` and `month`.
String. A unit of time. Possible values `hour`, `day`, `business_day`, `week` and `month`.

amount.description: Int. A non-negative integer in cents representing how much to charge.

currency.description: String. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase - [supported currencies](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

currencyOptions.description: List(Resource). Please see argument details Currency Option

amount.description: Int. (Required) Int. A non-negative integer in cents representing how much to charge.

currency.description: String. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase - [supported currencies](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

taxBehavior.description: Specifies whether the rate is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified.

provider.description:
The provider type for the stripe package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

address.description:
Map(String). Address map with fields related to the address: `line1`, `line2`, `city`, `state`
, `zip` and `country`.

addressLine1Check.description:
String. If address `line1` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`,
or `unchecked`.

addressZipCheck.description:
String. If address `zip` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`,
or `unchecked`.

availablePayoutMethods.description:
List(String). A set of available payout methods for this card. Only values from this set
should be passed as the method when creating a payout.

brand.description:
String. Card brand. Can be `American Express`, `Diners Club`, `Discover`, `JCB`, `MasterCard`, `UnionPay`
, `Visa`, or `Unknown`.

country.description:
String. Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a
sense of the international breakdown of cards you’ve collected.

customer.description: String. The customer that this card belongs to.

cvc.description:
Int. Card security code. Highly recommended to always include this value, but it's required only
for accounts based in European countries.

cvcCheck.description:
String. If a `cvc` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`. A
result of `unchecked` indicates that CVC was provided but hasn’t been checked yet

expMonth.description: Int. Number representing the card's expiration month.

expYear.description: Int. Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

fingerprint.description:
String. Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether
two customers who’ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize
card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card
number.

funding.description: String. Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

last4.description: String. The last four digits of the card.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for
storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

number.description: String. The card number, as a string without any separators.

tokenizationMethod.description:
String. If the card number is tokenized, this is the method that was used. Can
be `android_pay` (includes Google Pay), `apple_pay`, `masterpass`, `visa_checkout`, or `null`.

address.description:
Map(String). Address map with fields related to the address: `line1`, `line2`, `city`, `state`
, `zip` and `country`.

customer.description: String. The customer that this card belongs to.

cvc.description:
Int. Card security code. Highly recommended to always include this value, but it's required only
for accounts based in European countries.

expMonth.description: Int. Number representing the card's expiration month.

expYear.description: Int. Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for
storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

number.description: String. The card number, as a string without any separators.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Card resources.

funding.description: String. Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

last4.description: String. The last four digits of the card.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for

number.description: String. The card number, as a string without any separators.

tokenizationMethod.description:

amountOff.description: Int. Amount (in the currency specified) that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer.

appliesTos.description: List(String). A list of product IDs this coupon applies to.

couponId.description: String. Unique string of your choice that will be used to identify this coupon when applying it to a customer.

currency.description: String. Required if `amount_off` has been set, the three-letter ISO code for the currency of the amount to take off.

duration.description: String. Describes how long a customer who applies this coupon will get the discount. One of `forever`, `once`, and `repeating`.

durationInMonths.description: If duration is repeating, the number of months the coupon applies. Null if coupon duration is forever or once.

maxRedemptions.description: Int. Maximum number of times this coupon can be redeemed, in total, across all customers, before it is no longer valid.

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

name.description: String. Name of the coupon displayed to customers on for instance invoices or receipts.

percentOff.description: Float. Percent that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer for the duration of the coupon. For example, a coupon with percent_off of 50 will make a $100 invoice $50 instead.

redeemBy.description: String. Date after which the coupon can no longer be redeemed. Expected format is in the `RFC3339`.

timesRedeemed.description: Int. Number of times this coupon has been applied to a customer.

valid.description: Bool. Taking account of the above properties, whether this coupon can still be applied to a customer.

address.description: Map(String). The customer’s address, for all individual fields see: Address Fields.

balance.description: Int. Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

defaultInvoicePrefix.description: String. The default invoice prefix generated by Stripe when not individual invoice prefix provided.

description.description: String. An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object. It is displayed alongside the customer in the dashboard.

email.description: String. Customer’s email address. It’s displayed alongside the customer in your dashboard and can be useful for searching and tracking. This may be up to 512 characters.

invoicePrefix.description: String. The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be `3–12 uppercase letters or numbers`.

invoiceSettings.description: Map(String). Default invoice settings for this customer. For supported fields see: Invoice Settings Fields.

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

name.description: String. The customer’s full name or business name.

nextInvoiceSequence.description: Int. The sequence to be used on the customer’s next invoice. Defaults to 1.

preferredLocales.description: List(String). Customer’s preferred languages, ordered by preference.

shipping.description: Map(String). Mailing and shipping address for the customer. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer. For all individual fields see: Shipping Fields.

address.description: Map(String). The customer’s address, for all individual fields see: Address Fields.

This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

invoiceSettings.description: Map(String). Default invoice settings for this customer. For supported fields see: Invoice Settings Fields.

base64content.description: A content file to upload encoded by base64.

created.description: String. Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

expiresAt.description: Int. The link isn’t available after this future timestamp.

filename.description: String. The suitable name for saving the file to a filesystem.

linkData.description: Optional parameters that automatically create a file link for the newly created file.

links.description:
List(Resource). A list of [file links](https://stripe.com/docs/api/files/object#file_links) that point at this file.
Please see details of links.

object.description: String. String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

purpose.description:
String. The purpose of the uploaded file. One of these values are accepted: `account_requirement`,
`additional_verification`, `business_icon`, `business_logo`, `customer_signature`, `dispute_evidence`,
`document_provider_identity_document`, `finance_report_run`, `identity_document`, `identity_document_downloadable`,
`pci_document`, `selfie`, `sigma_scheduled_query`, `tax_document_user_upload`, `terminal_reader_splashscreen`

size.description: Int. The size of the file object in bytes.

type.description: String. The returned file type (for example, `csv`, `pdf`, `jpg`, or `png`).

url.description: String. The publicly accessible URL to download the file.

base64content.description: A content file to upload encoded by base64.

filename.description: String. The suitable name for saving the file to a filesystem.

linkData.description: Optional parameters that automatically create a file link for the newly created file.

purpose.description:
String. The purpose of the uploaded file. One of these values are accepted: `account_requirement`,
`additional_verification`, `business_icon`, `business_logo`, `customer_signature`, `dispute_evidence`,
`document_provider_identity_document`, `finance_report_run`, `identity_document`, `identity_document_downloadable`,
`pci_document`, `selfie`, `sigma_scheduled_query`, `tax_document_user_upload`, `terminal_reader_splashscreen`

purpose.description:
String. The purpose of the uploaded file. One of these values are accepted: `account_requirement`,
`additional_verification`, `business_icon`, `business_logo`, `customer_signature`, `dispute_evidence`,
`document_provider_identity_document`, `finance_report_run`, `identity_document`, `identity_document_downloadable`,
`pci_document`, `selfie`, `sigma_scheduled_query`, `tax_document_user_upload`, `terminal_reader_splashscreen`

size.description: Int. The size of the file object in bytes.

type.description: String. The returned file type (for example, `csv`, `pdf`, `jpg`, or `png`).

url.description: String. The publicly accessible URL to download the file.

active.description: Bool. Whether the configuration is active and can be used to create portal sessions. (On create it is always set as `true`)

businessProfile.description: List(Resource). The business information shown to customers in the portal. More details in Business Profile section

defaultReturnUrl.description: String. The default URL to redirect customers to when they click on the portal’s link to return to your website. This can be overriden when creating the session.

features.description: List(Resource). Information about the features available in the portal. Feature section described in Feature section

isDefault.description: Bool. Whether the configuration is the default.

loginPage.description: List(Resource). The hosted login page for this configuration. See details in Login Page Section.

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

active.description: Bool. Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to `true`.

billingScheme.description:
String. Describes how to compute the price per period. Either `per_unit` or `tiered`
. `per_unit` indicates that the fixed amount (specified in `unit_amount` or `unit_amount_decimal`) will be charged per
unit in quantity (for prices with `usage_type=licensed`), or per unit of total usage (for prices
with `usage_type=metered`). `tiered` indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as
defined using the `tiers` and `tiers_mode` attributes.

currency.description: String. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase - [supported currencies](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

currencyOptions.description:
List(Resource). Prices defined in each available currency option. For details
of individual arguments see Currency Options.

lookupKey.description: String. A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for
storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

nickname.description: String. A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

product.description: String. The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

recurring.description:
List(Resource). The recurring components of a price such as `interval` and `usage_type`. For
details of individual arguments see Recurring.

taxBehaviour.description:
String. Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of
taxes. One of `inclusive`, `exclusive`, or `unspecified`. Once specified as either `inclusive` or `exclusive`, it
cannot be changed, default is `unspecified`.

tiers.description:
List(Resource). Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires `billing_scheme`
to be set to `tiered`. See also the documentation for `billing_scheme`. For details of individual arguments
see Tiers.

tiersMode.description:
String. Defines if the tiering price should be `graduated`
or `volume` based. In `volume`-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per-unit price,
in `graduated` tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.

transferLookupKey.description:
Bool. If set to `true`, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing
price, and assign it to this price.

transformQuantity.description:
List(Resource). Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before
computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with `tiers`. For details of individual arguments
see Transform Quantity.

type.description:
String. One of `one_time` or `recurring` depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a
recurring (subscription) purchase.

unitAmount.description:
Int. A positive integer in cents (or `-1` for a free
price) representing how much to charge.

unitAmountDecimal.description:
Float. Same as `unit_amount`, but accepts a decimal value in cents with at most 12
decimal places. Only one of `unit_amount` and `unit_amount_decimal` can be set.

active.description: Bool. Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to `true`.

billingScheme.description:
String. Describes how to compute the price per period. Either `per_unit` or `tiered`
. `per_unit` indicates that the fixed amount (specified in `unit_amount` or `unit_amount_decimal`) will be charged per
unit in quantity (for prices with `usage_type=licensed`), or per unit of total usage (for prices
with `usage_type=metered`). `tiered` indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as
defined using the `tiers` and `tiers_mode` attributes.

of individual arguments see Currency Options.

type.description:
String. One of `one_time` or `recurring` depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a
recurring (subscription) purchase.

unitAmount.description:
Int. A positive integer in cents (or `-1` for a free
price) representing how much to charge.

unitAmountDecimal.description:

active.description: Bool. Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to `true`.

description.description: String. The product’s description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

features.description: List(String). A list of up to 15 features for this product. These are displayed in pricing tables.

images.description: List(String). A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

name.description: String. The product’s name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Whenever this product is sold via a subscription, name will show up on associated invoice line item descriptions.

packageDimensions.description: Map(Float). The dimensions of this product for shipping purposes. When used these fields are required: `height`,`length`,`width` and `weight`; the precision is 2 decimal places.

productId.description: String. The bespoke unique identifier for the object.

shippable.description: Bool. Whether this product is shipped (i.e., physical goods).

statementDescriptor.description: String. An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer’s credit card or bank statement. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all. This may be up to 22 characters. The statement description may not include `<`,` >`, `\`, `"`, `’` characters, and will appear on your customer’s statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. It must contain at least one letter.

taxCode.description: String. A tax code ID. Supported values are listed in the TaxCode resource and at https://stripe.com/docs/tax/tax-categories.

unitLabel.description: String. A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.

url.description: String. A URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for this product.

active.description: Bool. Whether the promotion code is currently active. Defaults to `true`.

code.description: String. The customer-facing code. Regardless of case, this code must be unique across all active promotion codes for a specific customer. If left blank, we will generate one automatically.

coupon.description: String. The coupon for this promotion code.

customer.description: String. The customer that this promotion code can be used by. If not set, the promotion code can be used by all customers.

expiresAt.description: String. The timestamp at which this promotion code will expire. If the coupon has specified a `redeems_by`, then this value cannot be after the coupon’s `redeems_by`. Expected format is `RFC3339`.

maxRedemptions.description: Int. A positive integer specifying the number of times the promotion code can be redeemed. If the coupon has specified a `max_redemptions`, then this value cannot be greater than the coupon’s `max_redemptions`.

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

restrictions.description: List(Resource). Settings that restrict the redemption of the promotion code. For details of individual arguments see Restrictions.

active.description: Bool. Whether the shipping rate is active (can't be used when creating). Defaults to `true`.

deliveryEstimates.description:
List(Resource). The estimated range for how long shipping will take, 
meant to be displayable to the customer. This will appear on CheckoutSessions.
For details please see Delivery Estimate.

displayName.description:
String. The name of the shipping rate, meant to be displayable to the customer. 
This will appear on CheckoutSessions.

fixedAmount.description:
List(Resource). Describes a fixed amount to charge for shipping. 
Must be present if type is `fixed_amount`. For details of individual arguments see Fixed Amount.

livemode.description: Bool. Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

metadata.description:
Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for
storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

taxBehavior.description:
Specifies whether the rate is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or
unspecified.

taxCode.description: String. A tax code ID. The Shipping tax code is `txcd_92010001`.

type.description: String. The type of calculation to use on the shipping rate. Can only be `fixed_amount` for now.

active.description: Bool. Whether the shipping rate is active (can't be used when creating). Defaults to `true`.

active.description: Bool. Flag determining whether the tax rate is active or inactive (archived). Inactive tax rates cannot be used with new applications or Checkout Sessions, but will still work for subscriptions and invoices that already have it set.

created.description: Int. Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

description.description: String. An arbitrary string attached to the tax rate for your internal use only. It will not be visible to your customers.

displayName.description: String. The display name of the tax rate, which will be shown to users.

inclusive.description:
Bool. This specifies if the tax rate is inclusive or exclusive.
* `percentage ` - (Required) Float. This represents the tax rate percent out of 100.

jurisdiction.description: String. The jurisdiction for the tax rate. You can use this label field for tax reporting purposes. It also appears on your customer’s invoice.

livemode.description: Bool. Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

object.description: String. String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

percentage.description: This represents the tax rate percent out of 100.

state.description: String. ISO 3166-2 subdivision code, without country prefix. For example, “NY” for New York, United States.

taxType.description: String. The high-level tax type, such as vat or sales_tax.

apiVersion.description: String. Events sent to this endpoint will be generated with this Stripe Version instead of your account’s default Stripe Version.

connect.description: Bool. Whether this endpoint should receive events from connected accounts (`true`), or from your account (`false`). Defaults to `false`.

description.description: String. Description of what the webhook is used for.

disabled.description: Bool. Disable the webhook endpoint if set to `true`. Can be used only for modification already existing webhook endpoint.

enabledEvents.description: List(String). The list of events to enable for this endpoint. `[*]` indicates that all events are enabled, except those that require explicit selection. All supported events listed here: [Stripe event types](https://stripe.com/docs/api/events/types).

metadata.description: Map(String). Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

secret.description: String. The endpoint’s secret, used to generate webhook signatures. This field is marked as `sensitive`.

url.description: String. The URL of the webhook endpoint.

apiVersion.description: String. Events sent to this endpoint will be generated with this Stripe Version instead of your account’s default Stripe Version.

connect.description: Bool. Whether this endpoint should receive events from connected accounts (`true`), or from your account (`false`). Defaults to `false`.

description.description: String. Description of what the webhook is used for.

disabled.description: Bool. Disable the webhook endpoint if set to `true`. Can be used only for modification already existing webhook endpoint.

url.description: String. The URL of the webhook endpoint.
